summary: Romantic Valentine Ask Web Page: a simple, single-purpose interactive page to ask the girlfriend to be the userâ€™s Valentine with Yes/No options, a playful unclickable/moving No interaction, and a meme-style â€œGood choiceâ€ confirmation image on Yes; designed to run locally on iPad Chrome using plain HTML/CSS/JS.
architectural_notes: No login required; app should be accessible via a shareable link.
Mobile-first responsive UI with lightweight animations for performance.
Optional audio (music/sfx) should be user-friendly (e.g., can be muted) and not required for core flow.
Deliver as a simple static HTML/CSS/JS page that can be opened and run locally in Chrome on an iPad (no backend required).
known_issues: Previous attempt to add the requested audio (tiny romantic harp sound / song) failed to build; needs retry.
Yes/No button spacing on the Valentine prompt screen is still too large; user wants only a small gap (tight like "Yes/NO").
User reiterates: keep only a small/tight gap between the â€œYesâ€ and â€œNoâ€ buttons (little space) on the Valentine prompt screen.
User requests further reduction of spacing: bring the â€œNoâ€ option even closer to â€œYesâ€ (tighter gap) on the Valentine prompt screen.

(Correct: â€œRiverfrontâ€), Q3 What was my first gift to you? (Correct: â€œFlower showpieceâ€), Q4 What do you like about me the most? Implement optional audio: gentle romantic background music and subtle sound effects for key interactions (e.g., start, selecting an option, correct answer, confetti), with an obvious mute/unmute control and audio off by default until the user enables it.

Provide a shareable link affordance: add a â€œShareâ€ button (or equivalent) that copies the current page URL to clipboard and shows a small confirmation message; the app must be accessible without login and work as a simple client-side experience.

new_feature_requests.summary: Welcome screen with title/subtitle and "Start the Love Test" CTA in romantic pastel aesthetic
5-question one-at-a-time MCQ quiz flow with progress indicator, hover micro-interactions, and correct-answer heart/confetti feedback
Score-based results: perfect (5/5) win screen with date coupon + redeem button and booking message; <5 teasing result screen with Yes/No Valentine prompt
"Valentine Trick" UX: clicking No repeatedly enlarges Yes/shrinks No with escalating messages until Yes is clicked; then show final celebration screen with confetti/hearts
UI/UX styling: soft pastel gradients, floating hearts background, rounded cards, smooth transitions, mobile-first responsive design
Optional audio: gentle background music and subtle sound effects
Deployment/access: shareable link, no login required, keep experience simple and fast
Single-page Valentine prompt (pink/white romantic theme) with Yes/No options, where hovering over No moves it away to prevent clicking; clicking Yes shows a meme image with text â€œGood choiceâ€
Add romantic background music (â€œsongâ€) and a tiny romantic harp sound effect (e.g., on Yes click) for the Valentine page, compatible with iPad Chrome

Ensure the romantic background song (looping background music) is present as a local static audio asset and is used by the existing audio controller so that when the user enables audio, the background song starts playing and loops; when audio is disabled, it stops.
Add an in-page â€œShareâ€ button that copies the current page URL to clipboard and shows a brief confirmation message (tap-friendly for iPad Chrome)
Add visible spacing/gap between the â€œYesâ€ and â€œNoâ€ buttons on the Valentine prompt screen (improve layout and tap separation)
Update the Valentine prompt button row to include a visible separator label like â€œorâ€ between the Yes and No choices (e.g., â€œYes or Noâ€)
Roll back/revert the app to the previously delivered Version 3 (restore Version 3 look and behavior)
